Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Cutthroat \Cut"throat`\ (k[u^]t"thr[=o]t`), n. One who cuts throats; a murderer; an assassin. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Cutthroat \Cut"throat`\, a. 1. Murderous; cruel; barbarous. [1913 Webster]
2. Ruthless; conducted without restraint; as, cutthroat competition. [PJC]

cutthroat adj 1: ruthless in competition; "cutthroat competition"; "bowelless readiness to take advantage" [syn: {fierce}, {bowelless}] 2: capable of or conducive to bloodshed; "a cutthroat rogue"; "a homicidal rage"; "murderous thugs" [syn: {homicidal}, {murderous}] n : someone who murders by cutting the victim's throat
